title: iVisa.com
body:
Since November 2021 I have been working at iVisa, an international startup specializing in travel documents. My tasks vary and span our entire stack but my focus leans towards the Front End and I write a lot a Vue and TailwindCSS code every day. 
My first responsibility was to write a whole suite of UI tests with Laravel Dusk and since then I have grown to work with the team on implementing diverse UI features for small and large parts of the application, such as a new mobile navigation screen, visa selection page or user account experience. 
I also had the chance to work on integrating generative AI to summarize our blogs and improve features for our admin side, like an YouTube iframe generator tool for markdown or document scanning processing.

title: CONCEPT.APP
body:
Early hire at an early-stage startup building a social platform with JavaScript, React, and Firebase. Front-end focused role with full-stack collaboration. 
Designed and built foundational UI features with React Hooks, prioritizing accessibility and responsive layouts for an improved user journey. Implemented a notification system using Websockets and Redux to support real-time user engagement. 
Collaborated on system design, database modeling, and Agile story organization in ClickUp to support rapid prototyping and iterative development.

title: Classic Cocktails
body:
I am currently building this app for the bartender and manager I used to be.  It helps me to hone my Vue and TS knowledge, as well as learn how to work with Google Firebase. It also gives me the opportunity to use the wealth of beverage knowledge accumulated over a decade of working in the cocktail industry.
Back when I was in the drinks trade we typically used a spreadsheet listing the house classic drinks recipes, and another for each season of new cocktails. What if we could customize the whole process and also have access to a network of friends' menus, archive and access all former menus and also integrate past seasons? This might be a great tool to identify a picky customer's order, or to save progress on cocktail creations for the spring menu drop, or simply to find your next hit for your home cocktail party

title: Carey Corea Art
body: After a successful project with Kyle Corea in 2022, he and his father contacted me to build a simple portfolio site where they could easily showcase and update Carey's artwork. The result is this one page site where each piece can be looked closer and more information requested. The mobile first design helps Carey's son Kyle spread the word in NYC and the simplicity allows for the artist's work to shine, albeit through a blue light screen.

title: Corea Creative
body:
Built as a freelance for New York City based video producer Kyle Corea, this multi-page portfolio website showcases some video reels from Mr Corea's Vimeo page as well as the services offered by his production studio. 
Technologies used are Next.js, React in JavaScript and CSS modules for styling, based on an Adobe XD wireframe.

title: Judi Boisson Home Collection
body:
Led the complete migration of an outdated Magento 1 site to Shopify for a quilt and linen brand. The original site was completely down with lost account access, requiring a strategic platform change rather than a simple redesign.

• Migrated from non-functional Magento 1 to Shopify for improved usability and maintenance
• Managed complete data transfer, domain setup, and new storefront design
• Improved conversion rates and elevated user experience
• Resulted in over $30k in sales in the first month post-launch

mainImage.alt: Judi Boisson Home Collection website screenshot

title: Space Tourism
body: Front End Mentor Project. Fictional space tourism agency responsive website, with in-page navigation. Built with Create React App, in JavaScript and Emotion Styled Components.

title: Jammming
body:
Jammming is a playlist builder, connected to your Spotify via the public api .
Built in React, JavaScript and CSS, as capstone project for the CodeCademy Web Development curriculum

title: Find Unused Images
body: I wrote and maintain this simple JavaScript CLI tool to find unused images in a project, originally because of technical debt in a project I was working on. It scans your codebase using pattern matching and returns a list of unused images. It's a great way to clean up your codebase, reduce the size of your project and keep tech debt in check.

title: Habit Tracker
body: To help with occasional procrastination, I created Habit Tracker to help me track my habits and goals. I made it a progressive web app so it could be installed on my phone and used offline. It allows you to set daily goals for habits, and see your progress over time by tracking streaks. It's built with React and JavaScript and uses Dexie for an easy local database.
